channel.title: Head gasket
channel.description:
Head gasket.
Here is the situation: I got an old lawn mower out of the shed, I modified the cam so that I can run it on air. It runs. Then I looked down the spark plug hole and saw that the entire piston was black and covered in shit, so I took the head off and cleaned off all the surfaces. But when I removed the head, I managed to break the gasket. I put the head back on (after cleaning off where the gasket used to be). The engine had a cronic leak from that. So I removed the head again and got some epoxy glue from my room and used that as a head gasket. I am currently waiting for it to dry, but from the first few tests of just turning the engine over, it is getting compression and vacuum.
The question is, how long will epoxy glue last as a gasket in an air cooled, air powered lawn mower engine? Also, would running it on steam fuck the epoxy glue?
I might just go to the mower shop and ask for a gasket.

item.title: Head gasket
item.dc:creator: @Wasteland Wasteland
item.description:
@Wasteland wrote:

It’s a pain cutting a new one out but you’ll end up with a good seal.

http://www.amazon.com/Mr-Gasket-9615-Compressed-Material/dp/B00068OLEW/ref=sr_1_1?s=automotive&ie=UTF8&qid=1287357987&sr=1-1

Read full topic

GASKET PAPER.
[/quote]

Rice Krispie box tbh ;)[/quote]

The old Kellogs trick is da best. Shame you sometimes ruin it when testing it though.

item.title: Head gasket
item.dc:creator: @Zack77 Zack77
item.description:
@Zack77 wrote:

As mopar said; I’ve actually used silicon as an intake gasket before…It worked for a while but don’t expect it to be “perfect”.

item.title: Head gasket
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Radeon:

What do you mean by running it on air? Have you figured out an alternative to non-renewable energy without the world knowing?

Compressed air… But over the next few weeks im gonna build a steam boiler and burn wood to make the steam.

Read full topic

item.title: Head gasket
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Well, when I run it on air, it tends to cool down quite a lot from the air taking the energy out of the metals when it decompresses.

Read full topic

item.title: Head gasket
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’d get a gasket or at least gasket maker/sealant (called RTV sealant), kind of like this:

They make different kinds for different temperatures, not sure how hot it would get though, running on air.

Read full topic
